data.title: Top 9 Michael Shea Books

data.text:
Dive into the world of captivating stories with our latest book roundup featuring Michael Shea Books. Get ready to embark on thrilling journeys filled with adventure and suspense. Experience the magic of these tales as they transport you to new heights and leave you craving for more.

As an Amazon Affiliate‚Ñ¢ we receive compensation through qualified purchases at no cost to you!

1. Betrayal of Trust

Betrayal of Trust delves into the world of pro-Nazi activities that have permeated American history, weaving together a chilling narrative under the menacing umbrella of the sinister American Firsters. The sinister organization has managed to infiltrate the highest echelons of power in Washington, manipulating key policies to further their own nefarious agenda.

Against this backdrop, a tenacious Foreign Office investigation unfurls, aiming to uncover the identity of the powerful figure driving these disturbing events. As investigators delve deeper into the shadowy corners of Washington, they slowly begin to unravel a tangle of conspiracy, betrayal, and deceit. Could this investigation hold the key to revealing the true fate of Hitler and Eva Braun, and possibly dismantling the American Firsters‚Äô iron grip on American policy?

In this gripping novel by Michael Shea, readers will be left on the edge of their seats as they navigate a twisted web of betrayal and trust that threatens the very fabric of American democracy. Betrayal of Trust offers a unique exploration of neo-Nazism, uncovering the darkest corners of American history and questioning the true motivations of those in power.

Authors: Michael Shea

Published Date: April 08, 1999

Print Type: BOOK

Categories: Neo-Nazism

Maturity Rating: NOT_MATURE

Language: en

2. Spin Off

In Spin Off by Michael Shea, the world‚Äôs prime leaders are mysteriously stricken with a deadly disease, referred to as ‚ÄòSurge disease. ‚Äò The nation‚Äôs safety is at stake, and the Prime Minister‚Äôs life hangs in the balance as the spread of this disease threatens to become a full-blown plague, unmatched in its deadly scope.

Enter Harper Guthrie, a renowned US scientist who has dedicated his career to eradicating rare diseases. Determined to prevent the global catastrophe, Guthrie enlists the help of several key individuals, including Lloyd Thane, the spin doctor of the Prime Minister, who has a vested interest in keeping the secret to himself. Together, they work with the UK research scientist, Rebecca Stevenson, who holds the crucial key to finding the cure. As multiple forces seek to halt the relentless spread, the trio races against time to unravel the conspiracy and save the world from an unprecedented disaster.

Michael Shea masterfully combines political intrigue, suspense, and international collaboration with his behind-the-scenes knowledge in the world of government to create a riveting thriller that will keep readers hooked from start to finish. Spin Off is a must-read for fans of suspense, science, and politics, and a heart-stopping tale of heroism and cooperation.

Authors: Michael Shea

Publisher: HarperCollins Publishers

Published Date: April 08, 2000

Print Type: BOOK

Categories: Disease

Maturity Rating: NOT_MATURE

Language: en

3. A View from the Sidelines

Step into the mesmerizing universe of A View from the Sidelines, an enthralling account of Michael Shea‚Äôs awe-inspiring journey side by side with prominent figures, from presidents to movie stars. This spellbinding memoir delves into the lives and experiences of the exceptional and the prominent, showcasing their triumphs, challenges, and the human aspects that make them more than mere public figures.

Experience the rare exclusive glances into the lives of leaders, influential entrepreneurs, and secret agents as Shea provides insightful information that is rarely made public. A View from the Sidelines provides a remarkable vantage point on the hidden realm behind the scenes where glitz, power, and mystery intertwine.

Embark on an unforgettable journey through the pages of time, with 216-pages of riveting narratives that transport you from the White House to glamorous movie sets and beyond. Michael Shea‚Äôs compelling storytelling brings to the forefront the human side of the powerful, offering a unique lens on the lives of those who are often seen as untouchable.

A View from the Sidelines, published by Sutton Publishing in 2003, is a must-read for anyone yearning for an intimate understanding of the lives of the great and the good. With no common rating or ratings count available, the 200-plus pages serve as a testament to the magnetic appeal of Michael Shea‚Äôs storytelling.

Don‚Äôt miss out on your opportunity to live out the thrilling rollercoaster of insights and anecdotes that awaits you in A View from the Sidelines.

Authors: Michael Shea

Publisher: Sutton Publishing

Published Date: April 08, 2003

Page Count: 216

Print Type: BOOK

Categories: Biography & Autobiography

Maturity Rating: NOT_MATURE

Language: en

4. The Brain: A Very Short Introduction

Embark on a journey through the labyrinth of human thought and consciousness with ‚ÄúThe Brain: A Very Short Introduction‚Äù by Michael O‚ÄôShea. This concise gem from the highly regarded Very Short Introductions series provides an enthralling, non-technical overview of the brain.

O‚ÄôShea delves into the fascinating world of neuroscience, addressing the mysteries of brain processes, perception, memory, motor control, and the causes of ‚Äòaltered mental states‚Äô. Furthermore, this captivating book discusses the potential future of neuroscience, exploring the intersection of artificial intelligence, gene therapy, the impact of the Human Genome Project, drug design, and transplantation. Intrigued?

This informative and engaging book is your entryway to the limitless realm of understanding the human brain.

Authors: Michael O‚ÄôShea

Publisher: OUP Oxford

Published Date: December 08, 2005

Page Count: 149

Print Type: BOOK

Categories: Medical

6. The Autopsy and Other Tales

‚ÄúThe Autopsy and Other Tales‚Äù is a remarkable collection of terrifying horror stories, bringing chills and suspense to readers. With its beautifully crafted illustrations, this book becomes a timeless treasure in the genre. Michael Shea‚Äôs vivid imagination and masterful storytelling have created a tale that captures your attention like never before.

As you delve into the twisted and macabre world of The Autopsy and Other Tales, you‚Äôll discover a world where fear and the unknown intertwine, leaving you with a lasting impression. Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to experience the unforgettable thrill of American horror tales like never before.

Authors: Michael Shea

Published Date: April 08, 2008

Print Type: BOOK

Categories: Horror tales, American

Maturity Rating: NOT_MATURE

Language: en

7. The Extra

A novel

‚ÄúThe Extra‚Äù by Michael Shea is a gripping novel that takes us deep into the world of Hollywood action-adventure films like never before. This satirical and savagely dark tale follows producer Val Margolian as he creates a new craze: ‚Äúlive-death‚Äù films, where the villains are sophisticated, electronically-controlled mechanical monsters. To make these films more realistic, Margolian employs an army of extras, who risk their lives for fame and fortune in the Zoo, a vast slum-like L. A.

These extras are willing to put their lives on the line because if they survive, they get paid handsomely and can improve their living conditions by destroying the animatronic monsters. The stakes are higher than ever, as the extras must confront deadly situations, all while striving for a better life. ‚ÄúThe Extra‚Äù is a wild and thrilling read that offers a fresh perspective on Hollywood‚Äôs excesses while leaving you on the edge of your seat.

Authors: Michael Shea

Publisher: Tor Books

Published Date: February 02, 2010

Page Count: 288

Print Type: BOOK

Categories: Fiction

Maturity Rating: NOT_MATURE

Language: en

8. Biodynamic Craniosacral Therapy, Volume Five

Explore the depths of prenatal and neonatal craniosacral therapy in Volume Five of Biodynamic Craniosacral Therapy. Written by renowned expert Michael J. Shea, Ph. D. , this innovative book is a must-read for practitioners and healers seeking to delve into the world of biodynamic craniosacral therapy. In this volume, Shea provides crucial information on the best practices for therapeutic approaches to pre- and neonatal babies, specifically low-birth-weight babies.

Part one of the book focuses on making physical contact with these delicate infants, offering detailed protocols for use in neonatal intensive-care units as well as at home. Shea also enlightens readers on therapeutic approaches for babies in utero, providing essential guidance for those seeking to practice biodynamically within the constraints of pregnancy. Lavishly illustrated with photographs and text descriptions, this section provides hands-on experience and knowledge that is invaluable for practitioners working with pre- and neonatal babies.

In part two, the series takes on a more introspective and meditative tone, with over fifty meditations and guided visualizations transcribed from the full foundation training in biodynamic craniosacral therapy. These meditations serve to help practitioners develop the proper orientation to the body and breath and to balance focused and unfocused attention. Shea also delves into the research surrounding mindfulness meditation, further enriching the content of this comprehensive book.

Biodynamic Craniosacral Therapy, Volume Five is a must-read for those seeking a deep understanding of biodynamic craniosacral therapy and looking to expand their repertoire of therapeutic approaches to pre- and neonatal babies. This valuable resource, brought to you by North Atlantic Books, will appeal to readers in the Health & Fitness category seeking to enhance their knowledge and expertise in this field.

Authors: Michael J. Shea, Ph.D.

Publisher: North Atlantic Books

Published Date: April 30, 2013

Page Count: 512

Print Type: BOOK

Categories: Health & Fitness

Maturity Rating: NOT_MATURE

Language: en
